page.title: 04DAY IN LIFE OF Mrs MAUCHEL
page.content: Mrs Mauchel is the Chairman of the Horsham District Council. Mrs. Mauchel goes to the office where her secretary gives her any letters that have arrived. The complaints are sent along to the appropriate department. Sometimes she is home for lunch. Occasionally she has to go to the Law Courts to decide if someone is guilty or not. They can pass a sentence of up to six months imprisonment or fines of up to Â£400. Mrs Mauchel is a part of the Health Authority, a family practitioner, a conciliator, and a Justice of the Peace. A conciliator means that she tries to settle any problems between a person and their doctor on an informal basis.
